View source Improve this doc

Attributes
type in module ng

Description

A shared object between directive compile / linking functions which contains normalized DOM element attributes. The the values reflect current binding state {{ }}. The normalization is needed since all of these are treated as equivalent in Angular:

     <span ng:bind="a" ng-bind="a" data-ng-bind="a" x-ng-bind="a">

Methods

  • $addCl***REMOVED***(cl***REMOVED***Val)

    Adds the CSS cl***REMOVED*** value specified by the cl***REMOVED***Val parameter to the element. If animations are enabled then an animation will be triggered for the cl***REMOVED*** addition.

    Parameters
    ParamTypeDetails
    cl***REMOVED***Valstring

    The cl***REMOVED***Name value that will be added to the element

  • $removeCl***REMOVED***(cl***REMOVED***Val)

    Removes the CSS cl***REMOVED*** value specified by the cl***REMOVED***Val parameter from the element. If animations are enabled then an animation will be triggered for the cl***REMOVED*** removal.

    Parameters
    ParamTypeDetails
    cl***REMOVED***Valstring

    The cl***REMOVED***Name value that will be removed from the element

  • $set(name, value)

    Set DOM element attribute value.

    Parameters
    ParamTypeDetails
    namestring

    Normalized element attribute name of the property to modify. The name is revers translated using the $attr property to the original name.

    valuestring

    Value to set the attribute to. The value can be an interpolated string.

Properties

  • $attr

    Returns
    object

    A map of DOM element attribute names to the normalized name. This is needed to do reverse lookup from normalized name back to actual name.
